person.persName: Samuel E. DeHaven (Oldham County State Sen/Rep)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, attorney. Jefferson County, Kentucky, native. Attended St. Joseph's College in Bardstown, Kentucky, from 1845 to 1848. Taught school in Oldham County from 1848 to 1850. Read law with George Armstrong in Oldham County. Began practicing law in LaGrange, Kentucky, in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Oldham County from 1857 to 1859. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Oldham County from 1859 to 1863. Attorney in Oldham County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Oldham County in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Oldham County from 1863 to 1865. Owned the Jefferson and Hardin Coal and Rock Oil Company in partnership with John Roberts, James S. Pirtle, William T. Applegate, John L. Hem, Charles G. Wintersmith, S. B. Thomas, Charlton D. Shean in 1865.
